New Records: The 154-run opening stand between Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Ibrahim Zadran is the second-highest opening stand in T20 World Cup history.
Key Match Events: Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Ibrahim Zadran added a 154-run opening stand, Fazalhaq Farooqi took his maiden five-wicket haul in T20Is, and Afghanistan won by 125 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: This was Afghanistan's Group C game of the T20 World Cup in Guyana.
Post-Match Reflections: Afghanistan started their World Cup campaign with a bang.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Uganda conceded at 10.85 in the first 14 overs, and they didn't give away a single boundary in the last six overs of the innings, the first such instance in the T20 World Cup.
Others: The match was played on June 03, 2024, in Providence, and it was the 5th Match, Group C (N) of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup.
